speakers.bio: Chris Richardson is a developer and architect. He is a Java Champion, a JavaOne rock star and the author of POJOs in Action, which describes how to build enterprise Java applications with frameworks such as Spring and Hibernate.
speakers.userBioShort: Founder of Eventuate, Author of POJOs in Action, creator of the original Cloud Foundry

speakers.bio: Craig has a passion for community and helping other developers improve their skills. He writes the column "Software Gardening" in DotNet Curry Magazine and is the co-author of "Continuous Integration in .NET" available from Manning.
speakers.userBioShort: Speaker, author, architect, and engineer. Currently he's a Senior Software Engineer at HealthEquity.

speakers.bio: Eugene Chuvyrov is  a Senior Cloud Architect at Microsoft. He works directly with both startups and enterprises to enable their solutions in Microsoft cloud, and to make Azure better as a result of this work with partners.
speakers.userBioShort: Cloud Architect at Microsoft focused on accelerating modern DevOps, Machine Learning and Blockchain.

speakers.bio: Gayle Laakmann McDowell is the founder and CEO of CareerCup.com and the author of three best selling books.
speakers.userBioShort: Gayle Laakmann McDowell is the founder and CEO of CareerCup.com and the author of three books.

speakers.bio: Team Lead of the Chromecast Technical Solutions Engineer team, a Java Champion and three time JavaOne Rock Star Presenter. Kevin has spoken at conferences such as JavaOne, Devoxx, JAX, O'Reilly Fluent, Silicon Valley Code Camp, JAX and HTML5DevConf.
speakers.userBioShort: Chromecast Technical Solutions Engineering Lead at Google, Java Champion, 3 time JavaOne Rock Star

speakers.bio: Mickey has been developing software systems and products for over 40 years, as a systems programmer, Tech Lead, Manager, VP Engineering, CTO, COO, and now CEO/CTO of his own company.
speakers.userBioShort: Mickey has been developing software products for over 40 years â€“ in a variety of leadership roles.

speakers.bio: Paul is the PyCharm and WebStorm Developer Advocate at JetBrains. Before that, Paul was a partner at Agendaless Consulting and co-founder of Zope Corporation, taking the first open source application server through $14M of funding.
speakers.userBioShort: Paul is the PyCharm and WebStorm Developer Advocate at JetBrains.
Tammy is a software development leader for over 20 years.
speakers.bio: Tammy has held a number of executive and management roles over the past 15 years, including VP engineering Roles at USA Tech, Cantaloupe Systems, E-Color, and Untangle Inc.
